thread.title: Maryville College suffers for turnovers - News Sentinel
thread.title_full: Maryville College suffers for turnovers - News Sentinel Story

author: News Sentinel staff
title: Maryville College suffers for turnovers - News Sentinel
text:
The math didn't add up in Maryville College's favor Saturday afternoon.
Six turnovers added up the Scots' first loss, 24-7 to North Carolina Wesleyan in Rocky Mount, N.C.
Maryville (4-1, 1-1 USA South) threw four interceptions and lost two fumbles. The Scots defense had a hand in forcing two turnovers by the Bishops but couldn't make up the difference.
A fumble on Maryville's first possession of the second half set up Chris Richardson's 20-yard field goal, which gave Wesleyan (1-4, 1-1) the lead for good, 10-7.
Wesleyan's offense was driven by a power trio.
After not having a 100-yard rusher this season, Gerrel Patton ran for 143 yards on 34 carries and scored a touchdown.
Dustin Midgett was 11-for-28 passing for 124 yards and a touchdown while Malik Adams caught eight passes for 99 yards and a score.
The Bishops had 366 yards of total offense.
The Scots' Chaz Rokins rushed for 80 yards. He scored Maryville's lone touchdown on a 10-yard run. The touchdown capped a 10-play, 84-yard drive that tied the game at 7 with 14:42 remaining in the first half.
Kent Minor led the Scots defensively with eight tackles and a forced fumble.
Bobby Tucker had seven tackles and three of Wesleyan's interceptions.
The loss dropped Maryville to third in the conference.
